Customers at a restaurant in the Marina Bay area in Singapore, on Thursday, April 11, 2024. title: The role of central              banks in a cashless world
summary: ECONOMICS has always had a strange and much-debated relationship with money.
content:
ECONOMICS has always had a strange and much-debated relationship with money.

For a long time, economists – including Nobel laureates like Merton Miller and Franco Modigliani – regarded money merely as a medium of exchange.

But by building on the work of John Maynard Keynes and Hyman Minsky, economists have since moved beyond a narrow focus on the quantity of money to consider its structural influence on the real economy and the financial system.

A structur

content:
Vietnam-Singapore Industrial Park in southern Bình Duong Province. — VNA/VNS

HO CHI MINH CITY: Rental rates for industrial land in Vietnam are forecast to slightly increase in the coming time, experts say.

According to property consultants CBRE, the surge in the next three years will be 3% to 9% per year in the north and 3% to 7% per year in the south.

Social housing buildings in Bắc Giang Province. — VNA/VNS Photo

title: Samsung fund invests in US gene therapy firm
summary: SEOUL: Samsung Life Science Fund, an investment fund created by Samsung affiliates, will invest in Latus Bio, a US gene therapy development company, according to Samsung Bioepis.
content:
SEOUL: Samsung Life Science Fund, an investment fund created by Samsung affiliates, will invest in Latus Bio, a US gene therapy development company, according to Samsung Bioepis.

It is the sixth investment made by the fund between Samsung Biologics, Samsung C&T and Samsung Bioepis, to explore new business opportunities in the biotechnology sector. The exact amount of investment has not been disclosed.

title: TD risks earningshit from US probe
summary: Toronto: With new allegations emerging surrounding US anti-money-laundering investigations into Toronto-Dominion Bank (TD), the lender could face a much higher fine than previously expected as well as a significant hit to its long-term financial performance, according to analysts at National Bank of Canada.

title: King, Queen to make first overseas state visit to Singapore
summary: Yang di-Pertuan Agong Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar and Raja Permaisuri Agong Raja Zarith Sofiah will undertake a state visit to Singapore on May 6 and 7, 2024 at the invitation of the republic's President Tharman Shanmugaratnam.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 5): Yang di-Pertuan Agong Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar and Raja Permaisuri Agong Raja Zarith Sofiah will undertake a state visit to Singapore on May 6 and 7, 2024 at the invitation of the republic's President Tharman Shanmugaratnam.

The Foreign Ministry in a statement Sunday said this will be the King’s maiden state visit since ascending the throne on 31 January 2024.

Wisma Putra said Their Majesties will be accompanied by Transport Minister

content:

title: Home Ministry looking to employ AI tech to tighten border control, says Saifuddin

content:

Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail, emphasised that with border control now consolidated under the Malaysia Checkpoints and Border Agency (MCBA), there's a critical need to employ cutting-edge AI technology to enhance its governance and operations.

content:

title: Ringgit outperforms most regional currencies despite slip against US dollar
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit outperformed most regional currencies in April despite depreciating one per cent month-on-month (MoM) against the US dollar.The ringgit's improved performance against the currencies of Malaysia's main trading partners was reflected in MIDF Research'...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit outperformed most regional currencies in April despite depreciating one per cent month-on-month (MoM) against the US dollar.

The ringgit's improved performance against the currencies of Malaysia's main trading partners was reflected in MIDF Research's trade-weighted ringgit index, which jumped higher by 0.3 per cent MoM to 85.24 last month.

In particular, the local currency strengthened against the Japanese yen (up 0.2 per cent) and Indonesian rupiah (up 0.11 per cent).

title: Lagenda Properties kicks off construction of first large-scale landed Rumah Selangorku project
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Lagenda Properties Bhd has broken ground of its inaugural township in Selangor that it claims will be the first large-scale landed Rumah Selangorku project.The Lagenda Ardea township will be developed in partnership with Selangor state government's ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Lagenda Properties Bhd has broken ground of its inaugural township in Selangor that it claims will be the first large-scale landed Rumah Selangorku project.

The Lagenda Ardea township will be developed in partnership with Selangor state government's wholly-owned Kumpulan Hartanah Selangor Bhd, according to Lagenda Properties.

The groundbreaking ceremony, held last Friday in Bernam Jaya, Hulu Selangor, was officiated by Selangor Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari.

title: Anwar lambasts foreign media over reports on fuel subsidy cut
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim described foreign media reports regarding fuel subsidy cuts as unethical, and said that no final decision had been made at the Cabinet level regarding the issue.
content:
BUTTERWORTH (May 5): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim described foreign media reports regarding fuel subsidy cuts as unethical, and said that no final decision had been made at the Cabinet level regarding the issue.

"I found recently, maybe because of our firm political stance, the neighbouring and international media continue to attack in terms of negative news, for example the casino development issue (in Johor)... it was never discussed and never reached my information, but it became a hot issue.

title: Ringgit expected to trade cautiously next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade cautiously against the US dollar in the near term as investors continue to closely watch local and global economic developments moving forward, an analyst said.Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade cautiously against the US dollar in the near term as investors continue to closely watch local and global economic developments moving forward, an analyst said.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said among others, the US Federal Reserve (Fed) chairman Jerome Powell has clearly indicated that the option for a rate rise is not in the central bank's baseline scenario although it is still concerned over inflation rate.

title: Bursa Malaysia likely to trade range-bound with upside bias next week

content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade range-bound with an upside bias hovering within the range of 1,575 to 1,600 next week, said an analyst. 

Rakuten Trade Sdn Bhd equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng said the FBM KLCI continued its rally last week, supported by buying interest in heavyweights.

"While we anticipate a brief pause for the bulls following the recent strong rally, the index has maintained its position above all exponential moving averages (EMAs).

title: UK’s Labour to impose VAT on boarding fees, private education — FT
summary: The UK’s Labour Party is set to impose value-added tax (VAT) on boarding fees as well as private education in the country if it wins the next election, Financial Times (FT) reported, citing party insiders.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 5): The UK’s Labour Party is set to impose value-added tax (VAT) on boarding fees as well as private education in the country if it wins the next election, Financial Times (FT) reported, citing party insiders.

Party leader Keir Starmer had said in 2021 that if he won power, he would end a long-standing VAT exemption for private schools, which would lead to a 20% rise in the cost of education, which the main opposition party estimated would raise up to £1.5 billion (RM8.9 billion) to fu

title: Kedah MB apologises to Anwar, Cabinet over ‘inappropriate remarks’
summary: Kedah Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Muhammad Sanusi Md Nor apologised to Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and Cabinet ministers who attended the state-level Madani Aidilfitri celebration on Saturday night.
content:
JITRA (May 5): Kedah Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Muhammad Sanusi Md Nor apologised to Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and Cabinet ministers who attended the state-level Madani Aidilfitri celebration on Saturday night.

Speaking at the event, Muhammad Sanusi sought forgiveness for making inappropriate remarks that could harm his relationship with others throughout his tenure as state menteri besar and also in a political capacity.

title: Anwar says nod given to conversion of Mada land for industrial, commercial development
summary: The federal government has agreed in principle to proposals to convert agricultural land within the Muda Agricultural Development Authority (Mada) area for industrial and commercial development.
content:
JITRA (May 5): The federal government has agreed in principle to proposals to convert agricultural land within the Muda Agricultural Development Authority (Mada) area for industrial and commercial development.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said further discussions with relevant parties will be held on this.

“We are considering, for example, proposals in certain areas originally under Mada, where a portion of the land could be converted for housing, ind

title: NCT Group, Smartsel & Mikro to drive NSIP capabilities
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: NCT Group of Companies has teamed up with Smartsel Sdn Bhd and Mikro Sdn Bhd to drive the capabilities of the NCT Smart Industrial Park (NSIP).The partnership also aims to introduce advanced sustainability practices to positively impact ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: NCT Group of Companies has teamed up with Smartsel Sdn Bhd and Mikro Sdn Bhd to drive the capabilities of the NCT Smart Industrial Park (NSIP).

The partnership also aims to introduce advanced sustainability practices to positively impact its carbon footprint.

A memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Smartsel, a licenced provider of network facilities and services, will focus on the integration of 4G and 5G networks to drive telecommunications and digital operations at the NSIP, while simultaneously bolster t

title: Developing community living sustainably
summary: In the May 6 issues of City & Country, the cover story features Eastern & Oriental Bhd’s (E&O) Andaman Island in Penang. The reclaimed island project is taking shape and will come in two phases. Phase one covers 253 acres, while phase two will cover 507 acres. Reclamation work for phase one started in 2015 and was completed in December 2019. Work on phase two is ongoing, with the entire reclamation exercise set to be completed by December 2028.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 5): In the May 6 issues of City & Country, the cover story features Eastern & Oriental Bhd’s (E&O) Andaman Island in Penang. The reclaimed island project is taking shape and will come in two phases. Phase one covers 253 acres, while phase two will cover 507 acres. Reclamation work for phase one started in 2015 and was completed in December 2019. Work on phase two is ongoing, with the entire reclamation exercise set to be completed by December 2028.

title: Treasure of Borneo
summary: Mathew Ngau Jau is not a fan of hectic city life, though there is certainly something to smile about as he visits Kuala Lumpur this week for a very special recognition at the 19th Boh Cameronian Arts Awards (BCAA).
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 5): Mathew Ngau Jau is not a fan of hectic city life, though there is certainly something to smile about as he visits Kuala Lumpur this week for a very special recognition at the 19th Boh Cameronian Arts Awards (BCAA).
